goal.core.program.dependencygraph

Class DependencyGraph<T extends Expression>

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.core.program.dependencygraph.DependencyGraph<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The node's type

    public abstract class DependencyGraph<T extends Expression>
extends java.lang.Object

    A DependencyGraph consists of a set of Nodes, where each node represents an expression from the KR language used. Links between the nodes represent dependencies. That is, whenever a link from one expression node to another expression node exists, the evaluation of the first expression depends on the evaluation of the second expression.

    For example, if the KR language is Prolog, then a clause p(X) :- q(X) in an agent program introduces a dependency between p(X) and q(X), where the evaluation of p(X) depends on the evaluation of q(X).

    A dependency graph is used to verify that predicates are both used as well as defined in an agent program, and for computing the view associated with a Module.

    The expressions stored in the nodes are supposed to have a unique signature, i.e. a pair name/arity, that is used to store nodes in a hash map.

    Author:
    K.Hindriks

    • Field Detail

      • graph

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Node<T extends Expression>> graph
        A hash map is used to store nodes in the dependency graph. The strings to index the nodes are the signatures associated with the expression stored in a node.

    • Constructor Detail

        public DependencyGraph()

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public abstract void add(DatabaseFormula formula,
       boolean defined,
       boolean queried)
                  throws GOALUserError
        Adds a definition to this DependencyGraph. The given formula may contain sub-expressions that define the main operator and that need to be stored in separate nodes as the defined operator may depend on these sub-expressions.
        Parameters:
        formula - The formula that is added to the graph.
        defined - Indicates whether the formula represents a definition.
        queried - Indicates whether the formula represents a query.
        Throws:
        GOALUserError

      • add

        public abstract void add(Query query)
                  throws GOALUserError
        Adds a Query to this DependencyGraph. If a query is a composed formula, then the formula is broken down in its constituents and represented by several Nodes.
        Parameters:
        query - The query that is added.
        Throws:
        GOALUserError

      • getUnusedDefinitions

        public java.util.List<? extends Expression> getUnusedDefinitions()
        Returns the definitions in the program that are never used.
        Returns:
        A list of all definitions that are unused.

      • getUndefinedQueries

        public java.util.List<? extends Expression> getUndefinedQueries()
        Returns those queries that have never been properly introduced.
        Returns:
        A list queries that reference undefined expressions.

      • getQueries

        public java.util.List<? extends Expression> getQueries()
        Returns all queries in the graph.
        Returns:
        A list of all queries.
